availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisa, Kentucky, lawyer. New York native. Studied law with L.T. Moore in Louisa. Married to Rebecca A. Moore. Father of Henry M. Gallup and Frederick G. Gallup. Farmer in Venice, Cayuga County, New York in 1850. Entered law partnership with L.T. Moore in Louisa. Lawyer in Louisa in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860. Appointed First Lieutenant in 14th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry on November 19, 1861 at Louisa. Promoted to Lieutenant Colonel on May 11, 1862. Promoted to Colonel on January 3, 1863. Mustered out on January 31, 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New York, Cayuga County, Venice. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, Louisa, p. 185. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lawrence County, p. 2.
